reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg:regulation.reg:title:
Minister of State for Infrastructure
Expected Results for the 2022/2023
Fiscal Year Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to the Minister of State for Infrastructure for the 2022/2023 fiscal year.
In this regulation, Act means the Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act.
The expected results that the Minister of State for Infrastructure is to achieve for the purposes of section 5 (3) of the Act are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: work with the Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure to advance critical pieces of transportation infrastructure that will benefit communities across B.C. and support B.C.'s economic recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic;

work with the TransLink Mayors' Council through its 10-year planning process to continue work to extend the Millennium Line to Arbutus Street, with an eventual terminus at UBC, and ensure prompt design and construction of the Surrey-Langley Skytrain;
continue to support planning to improve the movement of goods and people in the Fraser Valley, including the widening of Highway 1;
work with the Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure to advance a replacement for the George Massey crossing to support communities on both sides of the Fraser River;
work with the Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure to advance the successful completion of the Pattullo Bridge Replacement Project;

work with Cabinet colleagues, communities, and regions to support the planning and development of key transit projects, like high-speed transit links for the North Shore and the expansion of rail up the Fraser Valley, which will bring cleaner transit, support economic growth and deliver more construction jobs for B.C. workers;
submit to Cabinet a report on the results referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f) on or before March 31, 2023.

reg:regnote.in:em: Note: per B.C. Reg. 24/2023, Treasury Board orders that responsibility for the expected results specified in section 3 of the Minister of State for Infrastructure Expected Results for the 2022/2023 Fiscal Year Regulation, B.C. Reg. 38/2022, is transferred to the Minister of State for Infrastructure and Transit.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 28, s. 9.]
